modules.description: Manages fixed-size byte buffers with operations to set, retrieve, and extract sub-buffers. Works with unsigned byte arrays of type `Graphv_webgl_impl.Buffer.UByte.t` for low-level memory manipulation. Used to efficiently handle WebGL buffer data updates and slicing.

Calculates typographic metrics such as ascent, descent, and line gap from a font structure. It operates on a custom type `t` representing font characteristics. Used to adjust text rendering alignment and spacing in graphical interfaces.

Calculates the horizontal space a glyph occupies with `advance_width`, and retrieves the left-side bearing for positioning with `left_side_bearing`. It operates on glyph metrics data represented by type `t`. Used to adjust text rendering alignment and spacing in font-based UI elements.

Returns the minimum and maximum x and y coordinates of a rectangular region defined by integer bounds. Constructs a new rectangular region from four integer parameters representing left, top, right, and bottom edges. Used to represent and manipulate axis-aligned bounding boxes in 2D spatial computations.

Provides access to the 2D rendering context of an HTML canvas element, enabling low-level drawing operations. Works with the canvas rendering context type from the Js_of_ocaml library. Used to render graphics, text, and shapes directly on a canvas element in a web application.

Provides access to the 2D rendering context of an HTML canvas element, enabling low-level drawing operations such as line rendering, shape filling, and text placement. Works with the canvas rendering context type from the Js_of_ocaml library. Used to implement visual elements in web-based graphical applications.

Provides functions for rendering 2D vector graphics, including drawing shapes, text, and images with support for transformations and color blending. Works with primitives like paths, fonts, and image buffers, and integrates with OpenGL for rendering. Used to create interactive visual interfaces and data-driven graphics in web and desktop applications.

Provides 2D drawing capabilities on HTML canvas elements using the Js_of_ocaml rendering context. Supports operations like line drawing, shape filling, and text rendering with direct access to canvas context methods. Allows manipulation of stroke and fill styles, text alignment, and transformation matrices. Enables creation of custom visual elements such as graphs, diagrams, and interactive UI components.
